message.content:
cs.SY, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

The paper discusses a new approach to feedback control that is inspired by the ability of animals to rapidly focus attention and react to salient environmental features. This suggests a connection to robotics (cs.RO) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as the proposed approach aims to replicate high-performance control of movement in synthetic systems. The paper also introduces concepts of random channel controllability and observability for LTI control systems, which suggests a connection to systems and control (cs.SY). Finally, the use of saliency-based control suggests a connection to computer vision (cs.CV) and neural networks (cs.NE) as these fields often deal with identifying and reacting to salient features in visual data.
